meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by an anion.
meanings.sent1: The chemist studied the anionic properties of the compound.
meanings.sent2: The anionic molecule attracted positively charged ions.
meanings.sent3: The anionic solution was so negative, even the electrons avoided it.
meanings.sent4: Her presence in the room felt anionic, casting a shadow over the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The anionic nature of the substance made it repel other molecules like a magnet.

meanings.sent1: The anionic battery needed to be recharged.
meanings.sent2: The anionic particle moved towards the positive electrode.
meanings.sent3: The anionic cloud rained negativity on the parade.
meanings.sent4: His words carried an anionic charge that left a bitter taste in her mouth.
meanings.sent5: The anionic wire sparked with electricity, lighting up the room with a blue glow.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to an anion or anions.
meanings.sent1: The anionic compound reacted with the cationic solution.
meanings.sent2: An anionic bond forms between the atoms.
meanings.sent3: The anionic group chat was filled with negative emojis.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship had an anionic dynamic, always repelling each other.
meanings.sent5: The anionic cloud hung heavy in the sky, ready to release its negative charge.
